frame.name: Trust
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> thinks that the <fen>Information</fen> given by a particular <fen>Source</fen> is correct. The specific <fen>Content</fen> or <fen>Topic</fen> of the <fen>Information</fen> may also be described.</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who has an opinion about the reliability of a <fen>Source</fen> or the <fen>Information</fen> from the <fen>Source</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> trusts information about.
</def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> trusts the Source. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description of an aspect of the <fen>Cognizer</fen> that also affects the nature of the trusting, or a general comparison of the state-of-affairs to others.
<ex>She <fex name="Manner">foolishly</fex> <t>believed</t> him .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition:
<def-root>An object or action associated with the <fen>Cognizer</fen> which is so affected by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s belief that it reveals the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s state.
<ex>Her <t>trustworthy</t> <fex name="Expressor">eyes</fex> revealed that I was in no danger.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual that gives Information to the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
<ex>Why should we <t>believe</t> <fex name="sou">him</fex> ?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Information
FE.definition:
<def-root>The text or speech which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has heard and evaluates the truth of.
<ex>America <t>trusted</t> <fex name="inf">his declaration</fex> , to their detriment .</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: believe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: accept the statement of (someone) as true.

lexUnit.name: trustworthy.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: able to be relied on as honest, truthful, or reliable.

lexUnit.name: credulous.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having a tendency to believe that a state of affairs exists without adequate evidence

lexUnit.name: reliability.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: degree to which (something) should be believed.

lexUnit.name: trust.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: firm belief in someone or something.

lexUnit.name: credence.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: belief in or acceptance of something as true.

lexUnit.name: gullible.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having a tendency to trust a person too readily; easy to deceive

lexUnit.name: faith.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the belief in something (often religious)
